jobs.basic_qualifications:
- 3+ years of non-internship professional software development testing experience
- 1+ years of test automation frameworks and tools building experience
- Experience programming with at least one modern language such as Java, C++, or C# including object-oriented design
- Experience debugging, diagnosing, and troubleshooting complex, production software issues
- Knowledge of version control systems, eg., Perforce, Git
- Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field
jobs.description:
Amazon Leo is Amazon’s low Earth orbit satellite network. Our mission is to deliver fast, reliable internet connectivity to customers beyond the reach of existing networks. From individual households to schools, hospitals, businesses, and government agencies, Amazon Leo will serve people and organizations operating in locations without reliable connectivity.

Export Control Requirement: Due to applicable export control laws and regulations, candidates must be a U.S. citizen or national, U.S. permanent resident (i.e., current Green Card holder), or lawfully admitted into the U.S. as a refugee or granted asylum.

Are you excited about developing the propulsion and guidance, navigation, and control subsystems for an advanced fleet of communications satellites? In this role you'll create the integrated hardware and software tests used in the development of these systems.

As a guidance, navigation, and control and propulsion (GNC & Propulsion) software development engineer in test, you will support the systems lifecycle of the real-time software that flies the spacecraft from the moment of launch to re-entry. You'll work across both the GNC & Propulsion department and the broader Leo team to test all phases of the mission. In collaboration with partner teams, you will set the bar for rigor and technical excellence of the flight software deployed across the Leo fleet. You must be able to thrive and succeed in an entrepreneurial environment, and not be hindered by ambiguity or competing priorities.

The right candidate will be detail oriented, adaptable to new processes and tooling, and have experience scaling manual processes to fully automated software-driven processes. Prior experience with spacecraft or autonomous vehicles is helpful, but not a prerequisite.

Key job responsibilities
* Design, implement and evaluate integrated system tests applicable to Leo Guidance, Navigation and Control (GNC) & Propulsion systems including hardware endpoints
* Develop automated tooling interfacing flight code and ground services to achieve high fidelity tests
* Evaluate, integrate, and improve test frameworks and processes aligning with program needs
* Engage with key stakeholders to verify and validate system requirements
* Collaborate with software developers to implement testability features
* Create and review processes regarding test planning, execution, review, and automation

jobs.preferred_qualifications:
- Knowledge of overall system architecture, scalability, reliability, and performance in a database environment
- Familiarity with GNC concepts and algorithms
- Experience with real-time system testing
- Understanding of hardware-in-the-loop testing
- Experience testing integrated spacecraft or aircraft systems, including knowledge of testing standards (DO-178C, NASA-STD-8739.8)

Amazon also offers comprehensive benefits including health insurance (medical, dental, vision, prescription, Basic Life & AD&D insurance and option for Supplemental life plans, EAP, Mental Health Support, Medical Advice Line, Flexible Spending Accounts, Adoption and Surrogacy Reimbursement coverage), 401(k) matching, paid time off, and parental leave. Learn more about our benefits at https://amazon.jobs/en/benefits.

jobs.title: Software Dev Engineer in Test, Leo Guidance Navigation and Control & Propulsion

jobs.basic_qualifications:
- 5+ years of non-internship professional software development experience
- 5+ years of programming with at least one software programming language experience
- 5+ years of leading design or architecture (design patterns, reliability and scaling) of new and existing systems experience
- Experience as a mentor, tech lead or leading an engineering team
- Experience programming in Python
jobs.description:
Amazon Leo is Amazon's low Earth orbit satellite network. Our mission is to deliver fast, reliable internet connectivity to customers beyond the reach of existing networks. From individual households to schools, hospitals, businesses, and government agencies, Amazon Leo will serve people and organizations operating in locations without reliable connectivity.

Export Control Requirement: Due to applicable export control laws and regulations, candidates must be a U.S. citizen or national, U.S. permanent resident (i.e., current Green Card holder), or lawfully admitted into the U.S. as a refugee or granted asylum.

Innovation is part of our DNA! Our goal is to be Earth's most customer centric company, and we are just getting started. We need people who want to join an ambitious program that continues to push the state of the art in space based systems design.

Key job responsibilities
You should be comfortable with a high degree of ambiguity and relish the idea of solving problems that haven't been solved at scale before. Along the way, we guarantee that you will learn a lot, have fun and make a positive impact on tens of millions of people.

In this role, you will:
• Architect and build software to automate hardware test systems
• Develop software infrastructure to support test case execution
• Architect and build automation to support development (CI/CD)
• Align with various stakeholders on software requirements
• Document software requirements from users
• Support manufacturing as well as new product development
• Enable automated data collection, data analysis
• Deliver end-user documents
• Own and execute software quality and release process
• Work with electrical test equipment

A day in the life
You will have the opportunity to write software to test exciting products and help us bring our idea to reality. Your software will enable the team to validate our designs and ensure all our hardware is space-worthy. You will make daily decision on how to best create and deliver these tools.

About the team
This Software Development Engineer will have the opportunity to be a member of the Hardware Validation Team working within the wider Electrical Engineering Team. This highly collaborative group of engineers has a diverse range of backgrounds and knowledge and looking for help to build a scalable and reliable test automation solution. The team support both internal test needs as well as the needs of the manufacturing team. They like to leverage and share work across the entire organization as well as utilize AWS resources and tools to accelerate their work.

Applicants should apply via our internal or external career site.
jobs.title: Senior Software Dev Engineer, Amazon Leo

jobs.basic_qualifications:
- Work experience: 15+ years sales or pre-sales experience in Data/Analytics/AI-ML/Digital Transformation in Banking and Financial services with last couple of years in AI aligned roles.
- Technical Expertise: Proven experience in sales and/or practitioner roles across end-to-end AI value chain incl. LLMs, foundation models, RAG, model fine-tuning, ML Ops and AI infrastructure (GPUs, custom silicon and accelerated compute). Deep familiarity with AWS AI services, with the ability to translate technical capabilities to business outcomes.
- Executive & Sales Skills: Ability to engage and earn C-suite trust. Strong communication skills (simplify complex AI concepts for diverse audiences). Consultative selling with discovery, problem framing, solution design. Strong business acumen across financial modeling, ROI analysis, competitive dynamics. Experience managing complex, multi-stakeholder sales cycles.
jobs.description:
About the Role: AWS seeks a Senior AI Specialist Sales professional to drive adoption of AWS's full stack AI services across Banking and NBFCs in India and SAARC region. This individual contributor role requires deep AI/ML expertise, executive presence, and proven sales success. You'll engage C-level executives (CEOs, CTOs, CAIOs, CFOs, line of business owners) to accelerate Generative AI and Agentic AI adoption, bridging business strategy with technical implementation.

Key requirement: Ability to engage with CEO/LOB owners for strategic conversations to leverage AI for business transformation, as well as with CTO/CAIO for AI-implementation linked technical architecture conversations. AI specialist solution architects will support for Level 300+ deep dives.



Key job responsibilities
1. Engage C-suite executives to drive AWS AI services adoption: CEOs (business transformation), CTOs/CAIOs (technical architecture), CFOs (ROI models), line of business owners (use cases). Lead AI-focussed Executive Briefing Centers, board presentations, and strategic planning workshops.

2. Drive adoption of AWS full stack AI services (incl., but not limited to Amazon Bedrock, SageMaker, Amazon Q, Trainium / Inferentia etc.). Focus on Generative AI and Agentic AI as priority areas. Articulate business value from infrastructure (custom silicon) to applications; and position AWS AI services differentiation across aspects of model choice, security, cost optimization, responsible AI etc.

3. Solution Design & Sales Execution: Structure C-suite conversations on business outcomes that can be delivered using AI. Identify high-value industry-aligned use cases. Develop compelling business cases with quantified ROI and time-to-value. Own revenue targets for AI/ML services for assigned territories. Manage end-to-end sales cycles. Lead POCs and pilots demonstrating AWS AI services

4. Thought Leadership: Represent AWS at industry-aligned events. Develop executive presentations, thought leadership and case studies. Provide market insights to inform AWS product roadmaps
jobs.description_short: About the Role: AWS seeks a Senior AI Specialist Sales professional to drive adoption of AWS's full stack AI services across Banking and NBFCs in India and SAARC region. This individual contributor role
jobs.preferred_qualifications:
- MBA, or Bachelor's degree in computer science, engineering, analytics, mathematics, statistics, IT or equivalent
- AWS certification
- Experience working as Chief AI Officer, AI Practice leader or AI Solution Leader.
- Published thought leadership in AI/ML.
- Work experience with Hyperscalers, Strategy Consulting, Technology consulting arm of Big 4, AI consulting/services firms, GSIs, Banking GCCs, ISVs.

Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. Thought Leadership: Represent AWS at industry-aligned events. Develop executive presentations, thought leadership and case studies. Provide market insights to inform AWS product roadmaps


About the team
Diverse Experiences
Amazon values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.

Why AWS
Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.

Work/Life Balance
We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud.

Inclusive Team Culture
Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.

Mentorship and Career Growth
We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.

jobs.basic_qualifications:
- 3+ years of analyzing and interpreting data with Redshift, Oracle, NoSQL etc. experience
- Experience with data visualization using Tableau, Quicksight, or similar tools
- Experience with data modeling, warehousing and building ETL pipelines
- Experience in Statistical Analysis packages such as R, SAS and Matlab
- Experience using SQL to pull data from a database or data warehouse and scripting experience (Python) to process data for modeling
- Speak, write, and read fluently in Japanese
- 情報工学、コンピュータサイエンス、エンジニアリング、数学、物理、などの学士号
- ビジネス分野における3年以上のデータ分析経験
- ビジネス要件の集約、BIツールを使用してのデータ抽出、KPI策定、データ可視化、レポート作成などの3年以上の経験
- 大規模なデータセットを使い複雑で高度に最適化されたSQLを作成した実務経験
- スクリプトまたはコンピューティング言語の経験（例：Pythonなど）
- 日本語が流暢で、ビジネス上のドキュメント作成やメールでのコミュニケーションが英語でできる
- 多国籍/多様性のあるグループで働くことができる
jobs.description:
アマゾンは“地球上でもっとも豊富な品揃え”と“地球上でもっともお客様を大切にする企業であること”をミッションとしています。私達の提供するCustomer Experience（顧客満足度）は、品揃え、低価格、および利便性の三つの柱があります。アマゾンジャパンはオペレーション（運営・推進）事業の拠点として、約30のフルフィルメントセンター（Fulfillment Center, FC）を持ち、よりよいCustomer Experienceを提供するために拡大を続けています。FCは最先端のシステム、設備が導入された物流拠点で、2023年には14億個を超える商材を出荷しています。FCの物流管理業務は、物流倉庫の管理というよりは製造業に近い工程管理となっています。

この度、APEX-RoW Technology Solutions (ARTS)は、FC Network Planning チームと共に、FCのオペレーションを、テクノロジーで意欲的に支える、顧客志向のBusiness Intelligence Engineerを募集します。本ポジションは、日本全国のAmazon Fulfillment Network全体から取得するBig Dataを効率的に有効活用して、オペレーション部門が継続的にお客様のために、コスト削減、配送スピードの向上、セレクションの拡大をしていくことに貢献します。オペレーションの課題にデータ分析、データパイプライン構築、データ可視化などの最新の手法を提供することで、標準化、自動化、最適化を推進します。

本ポジションの魅力
非常に速いスピードで業務が展開され、日々多くの変化があります。事業が急速に拡大していく中、新しいことに積極的にチャレンジすることが可能な環境であり、ビジネスの成長と共に自分自身も成長することができます。また、データマネジメントの観点では以下のような環境です。

- データドリブンな組織で、ビッグデータを長期に渡ってビジネスに有効に活用する手法を学びます
- 多様なバックグラウンド・スキルを持つエンジニアのメンバー、ビジネス側のスペシャリスト達と共にプロジェクトを推進します
- KPI、BIダッシュボード、データパイプライン等の設計と構築において全工程で関与することができ、裁量を持って推進いただけます
- AWS（Redshift、S3、Lambda、QuickSight等）のスタンダードに基づいた開発ができるBIEとして成長できます

活躍していただける方
- フレキシビリティとスピード感を常に持ち、お客様とAmazonがより良くなるために主体的に課題解決やアクションに取り組める方
- 課題の本質を見極め、問題の根本原因を特定し、本質的な対策を考え、実行することができる方
- 社内の顧客にあたる部門、ステークホルダーと協力しながら、改善を進めていくことができる方

Key job responsibilities
- データ分析によりアクション可能な施策の提案を行いFCオペレーションの課題解決をサポートする
- データパイプラインを構築し一連のプロセスを自動化する
- メトリクス、レポート、ダッシュボードを設計・開発する
- ステークホルダーと丁寧なコミュニケーションを行い、本質的なニーズを明らかにし、あるべき姿を提案できる
- 社内におけるデータハンドリングのベストプラクティスを顧客に提供し、データを最大限に活用できるメカニズムを構築する

A day in the life
平均的な一日の業務の流れは以下の通りです。

- 毎日のスタンドアップミーティングに出席し、ステータスのアップデートを行う
- 社内のステークホルダーとミーティングをしてニーズを確認する
- 仕様をまとめてデザインドキュメントを作成する
- BI分析/ソリューションを開発する
- 新しいBIテクノロジーについて学ぶ
jobs.description_short: アマゾンは“地球上でもっとも豊富な品揃え”と“地球上でもっともお客様を大切にする企業であること”をミッションとしています。私達の提供するCustomer Experience（顧客満足度）は、品揃え、低価格、および利便性の三つの柱があります。アマゾンジャパンはオペレーション（運営・推進）事業の拠点として、約30のフルフィルメントセンター（Fulfillment Center, FC）を持ち、よりよいCustomer
jobs.preferred_qualifications:
- Experience with AWS solutions such as EC2, DynamoDB, S3, and Redshift
- Experience in data mining, ETL, etc. and using databases in a business environment with large-scale, complex datasets
- 関連する技術分野の修士号以上
- ビジネスインテリジェンス、データエンジニアリングの経験
- クラウドベースの基本的なツールの使用経験
- ロジスティクス、サービス、製造業界での2年以上の実務経験
- プロセス改善の推進経験
- 組織の様々なレベルで複数のステークホルダーを扱うマネジメントの経験
- 複雑で大規模な問題解決の経験、タイトなスケジュール環境での業務経験

jobs.title: Business Intelligence Engineer, ARTS

jobs.basic_qualifications:
- Work experience: 15+ years sales or pre-sales experience in Data/Analytics/AI-ML/Digital Transformation in Public sector with last couple of years in AI aligned roles.
- 2. Technical Expertise: Proven experience in sales and/or practitioner roles across end-to-end AI value chain incl. LLMs, foundation models, RAG, model fine-tuning, ML Ops and AI infrastructure (GPUs, custom silicon and accelerated compute). Deep familiarity with AWS AI services, with the ability to translate technical capabilities to business outcomes.
- 3. Executive & Sales Skills: Ability to engage and earn C-suite trust. Strong communication skills (simplify complex AI concepts for diverse audiences). Consultative selling with discovery, problem framing, solution design. Strong business acumen across financial modeling, ROI analysis, competitive dynamics. Experience managing complex, multi-stakeholder sales cycles.
jobs.description:
AWS seeks a Senior AI Specialist Sales professional to drive adoption of AWS's full stack AI services across Public sector in India and SAARC region. This individual contributor role requires deep AI/ML expertise, executive presence, and proven sales success. You'll engage C-level executives (CEOs, CTOs, CAIOs, CFOs, line of business owners) to accelerate Generative AI and Agentic AI adoption, bridging business strategy with technical implementation.
Ability to engage with CEO/LOB owners for strategic conversations to leverage AI for business transformation, as well as with CTO/CAIO for AI-implementation linked technical architecture conversations. AI specialist solution architects will support for Level 300+ deep dives.

Key job responsibilities
Engage C-suite executives to drive AWS AI services adoption: CEOs (business transformation), CTOs/CAIOs (technical architecture), CFOs (ROI models), line of business owners (use cases). Lead AI-focussed Executive Briefing Centers, board presentations, and strategic planning workshops.

Drive adoption of AWS full stack AI services (incl., but not limited to Amazon Bedrock, SageMaker, Amazon Q, Trainium / Inferentia etc.). Focus on Generative AI and Agentic AI as priority areas. Articulate business value from infrastructure (custom silicon) to applications; and position AWS AI services differentiation across aspects of model choice, security, cost optimization, responsible AI etc.

Solution Design & Sales Execution: Structure C-suite conversations on business outcomes that can be delivered using AI. Identify high-value industry-aligned use cases. Develop compelling business cases with quantified ROI and time-to-value. Own revenue targets for AI/ML services for assigned territories. Manage end-to-end sales cycles. Lead POCs and pilots demonstrating AWS AI services

Thought Leadership: Represent AWS at industry-aligned events. Develop executive presentations, thought leadership and case studies. Provide market insights to inform AWS product roadmaps


About the team
Diverse Experiences
Amazon values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.

Why AWS
Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.

Work/Life Balance
We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud.

Inclusive Team Culture
Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.

Mentorship and Career Growth
We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
jobs.description_short: AWS seeks a Senior AI Specialist Sales professional to drive adoption of AWS's full stack AI services across Public sector in India and SAARC region. This individual contributor role requires deep AI/ML
jobs.preferred_qualifications:
- MBA, or Bachelor's degree in computer science, engineering, analytics, mathematics, statistics, IT or equivalent
- 2. AWS certification
- 3. Experience working as Chief AI Officer, AI Practice leader or AI Solution Leader.
- 4. Published thought leadership in AI/ML.
- 5. Work experience in Public sector with Hyperscalers, Strategy Consulting, Technology consulting arm of Big 4, AI consulting/services firms, GSIs, GCCs, ISVs.

Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. jobs.basic_qualifications:
- High School diploma or equivalent
- Knowledge of basic mechanical aptitude and equipment troubleshooting
- Experience working in a fast-paced, team environment
- Can demonstrate strong attention to safety and ability to follow detailed procedures
- Travel up to 25% of the time
- Driver's license
jobs.description:
Here at Amazon, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of diversity and inclusion of our teams within the organization.

How do you get items to customers quickly, cost-effectively, and—most importantly—safely, in less than an hour? And how do you do it in a way that can scale? Our teams of hundreds of scientists, engineers, aerospace professionals, and futurists have been working hard to do just that! We are delivering to customers, and are excited for what’s to come. Check out more information about Prime Air on the About Amazon blog (https://www.aboutamazon.com/news/transportation/amazon-prime-air-delivery-drone-reveal-photos). If you are seeking an iterative environment where you can drive innovation, apply state-of-the-art technologies to solve real world delivery challenges, and provide benefits to customers, Prime Air is the place for you.
Come work on the Amazon Prime Air Team!

Prime Air is revolutionizing delivery services through innovative drone technology. We're seeking an Autonomous Vehicle Assistant to support our drone delivery operations through ground support activities, basic operational tasks, and community engagement.


Key job responsibilities
* Support daily drone operations by handling and organizing equipment, including batteries and related components
* Monitor airspace in the area of operations and report any potential hazards or obstacles
* Assist with basic warehouse tasks including inventory management and package preparation
* Execute standard operating procedures while maintaining safety and compliance standards
* Engage positively with community members and address basic inquiries about our operations
* Document and report operational activities using standard templates and tools
* Safely and efficiently deliver packages to customers by car, ensuring on-time arrival, accurate handling, and providing excellent service while adhering to all traffic laws and company safety standards


This role requires the ability to carry/lift up to 50 pounds, stand/walk during shifts lasting up to 12 hours, and frequently push, pull, squat, bend and reach. In addition, this role requires the ability to work outside in various weather conditions.

This role requires the ability to work any shift, including nights, weekends, and holidays

This role may require travel, up to 25% of the time

Export Control License: This position may require a deemed export control license for compliance with applicable laws and regulations. Placement is contingent on Amazon’s ability to apply for and obtain an export control license on your behalf.

This position will be subject to Department of Transportation (DOT) drug and alcohol testing if conducting safety sensitive functions as defined by the FAA. Federal law also requires Amazon to determine an applicant's DOT drug and/or alcohol testing history prior to hiring him/her into a position that would require them to conduct safety sensitive functions as defined by the FAA
